name: hbalw
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0, wff w1

stmt.origin: syl(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))
-| wi(w0, wal(s1, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(w0, wal(s1, w0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffss(s1, s2)
-| diffsw(s1, w1)
-| diffsw(s2, w0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(w0, wal(s1, w0))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffss(s1, s2)
-| diffsw(s1, w1)
-| diffsw(s2, w0)

comment: Weak version of ~ hbal . Uses only Tarski's FOL axiom schemes. Unlike ~ hbal , this theorem requires that ` x ` and ` y ` be distinct, i.e. not be bundled. (Contributed by NM, 19-Apr-2017.)
